results.title: Am I normal?
results.creator_credit: David Shepard, Debra Franco and New Day Films
results.brief_description: A lighthearted film about male puberty. A young teenager finds answers to his questions about bodily changes such as erection, wet dreams and masturbation. Also deals with related issues such as peer group pressure, self-image, and concepts of masculinity. Includes animated sequences. A companion to Dear Diary. TEACHER PREVIEW RECOMMENDED
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Shepard, Debra Franco and New Day Films

results.title: American graffiti [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Francis Ford Coppola, Coppola Co Productions and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: This film from the director of the “Star Wars” trilogy is one of the most popular films of the 1970’s. The misadventures of four Californian teenagers on a late summer night in 1962, two of whom are leaving for college the next day, became the focal point for a trip back to the last “innocent” year of the 1960’s. Features a fine group of young actors who went on to become cinema and TV favourites, including Ron Howard, Richard Dreyfuss and Cindy Williams. The soundtrack features nostalgic hits from the heyday of Rock’n’Roll which takes the viewer back to a more innocent era when life was a lot less complicated. Don’t miss the great cameo appearance from Harrison Ford in the “toughest” role of his career.

results.title: American beauty [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sam Mendes, Dan Jinks, Bruce Cohen, Jinks, NBCUniversal and Cohen
results.brief_description: Director Sam Mendes makes his feature film debut with this film about the dark side of an American family and the nature and cost of beauty in a culture obsessed with outward appearances. Kevin Spacey plays Lester Burnham, a man in his mid-40s going through an intense mid-life crisis. His relationship with his wife Caroline (Annette Bening) is not a warm one - on the surface she is in full control of her life, inside she feels empty and desolate. Their teenage daughter Jane (Thora Birch) is depressed and has a chronic lack of self-esteem. Lester falls into uncontrollable lust with Jane’s beautiful best friend Angela (Mena Suvari) and she becomes part of a drastic plan to change his body and his life. Meanwhile, their new next-door neighbor, Colonel Fitts (Chris Cooper) has spent a lifetime in the Marine Corps and can tolerate no other way of life, which makes things very difficult for his son Ricky, an aspiring filmmaker and part-time drug dealer who is obsessed with beauty, wherever and whatever it may be. This film is a darkly humourous, scathing and shocking journey through life in suburban America. (Awards: Academy Awards for Best Film, Best Director, Best Actor 1999)

results.title: American Ballet Theatre in San Francisco
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Robin Scott and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a companion piece to “American Ballet Theatre at the Met” and features five short ballets including two pas de deaux performed by the American Ballet Theater at the War Memorial Opera House, San Francisco with the San Francisco Opera Orchestra on 1st March 1985. Artistic director: Mikhail Baryshnikov. Airs: Music by George Frideric Handel, choreography by Paul Taylor, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Peter Fonseca, Johan Renvall, Lisa Rinehart. Jardin aux lilas (Lilac garden): Music by Ernest Chausson, choreography by Antony Tudor, conducted by Alan Barker and featuring dancers Leslie Browne, Martine Van Hamel, Robert La Fosse, Michael Owen. The Black swan from Swan Lake (Act III): Pas de deaux. Music by Piotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky, choreography by Marius Petipa, conducted by Alan Barker and featuring dancers Cynthia Gregory, Fernando Bujones. Romeo and Juliet - Balcony pas de deux (Act I): Music by Sergei Prokofiev, choreography by Kenneth MacMillan, conducted by Alan Barker and featuring dancers Natalia Makarova, Kevin McKenzie. Great galloping Gottschalk: Music by Louis Moreau Gottschalk, choreography by Lynne Taylor-Corbett, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Susan Jaffe, Robert La Fosse.

results.title: American Ballet Theatre at the Met
results.creator_credit: Brian Large and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: These three wonderful ballets plus a pas de deux were performed by the American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House, New York, on 11 June 1984. Les Sylphides: Music by Frideric Chopin, choreography by Michel Fokine, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Mikhail Baryshnikov, Cynthia Harvey, Marianna Tcherkassky, Cheryl Yeager. Sylvia: Music by Leo Delibes, choreography by George Balanchine, conducted by Alan Barker and featuring dancers Patrick Bissell, Martina Van Hamel. Triad: Music by Serge Prokofiev, choreography by Kenneth MacMillan, conducted by Alan Barker with violin solo by Dennis Cleveland and featuring dancers Robert La Fosse, Amanda McKerrow, Johan Renvall. Paquita: Music by Ludwig Minkus, choreography by Natalia Makarova, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Fernando Bujones, Cynthia Gregory.

results.title: America: from Hitler to M-X
results.creator_credit: Joan Harvey, Saul Newton, Ralph Klein, Albee Gordon, Fourth Wall Repertory and Parallel Films
results.brief_description: A striking film statement about the military aims of the United States today; its longstanding first strike policy, and the escalating threat of worldwide annihilation. Here is an expose of America’s top level corporate and banking links with fascism for over sixty years. The film indicts the United States as aggressor in today’s international move to war

results.title: America wide
results.brief_description: This multi-media presentation contains thousands of images of America (taken across all 50 states) as photographed by Australian Ken Duncan. The stunning panoramic images convey the diversity of the landscape and the beauty of nature. The images are accompanied by music composed by Andy Sorenson, with eleven separate tracks. Also includes the piece Song for America by Kathy Johnston.

results.title: America abroad
results.creator_credit: Michael Ingrams, Peter Hunt, Intertel and Associated-Rediffusion
results.brief_description: Approximately 2,000,000 United States citizens live and work abroad, in some 70 nations which benefit from American aid. Four of these countries and some of these United States citizens are in Cambodia, Vietnam, Pakistan and Ghana.

results.title: Amazon to ice
results.brief_description: Explore the wonderous waterways of South America from the infamous Tierra del Fuego to the raging rapids of the Upper Amazon; an area studded with relics from the ancient Inca past. A truly breathtaking journey includes the Moreno Glacier, the face of the Iguazu Falls and a visit to the inhabitants of the Islands in Lake Titicaca.

results.title: Am I Normal? (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Am I Normal? is a humorous situation comedy about the experiences boys go through during puberty. It presents facts about male sexual development while simultaneously raising important issues about masculinity, identity and peer pressure.
results.description: Am I Normal? is a humorous situation comedy about the experiences boys go through during puberty. It presents facts about male sexual development while simultaneously raising important issues about masculinity, identity and peer pressure.
